pkgmetadata.longdescription: Assessment of Agreement using the Total Deviation Index // The total deviation index (TDI) is an unscaled statistical measure used to evaluate the deviation between paired quantitative measurements when assessing the extent of agreement between different raters. It describes a boundary such that a large specified proportion of the differences in paired measurements are within the boundary (Lin, 2000) https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/10641028/. This R package implements some methodologies existing in the literature for TDI estimation and inference in the case of two raters.
